title.narrative: AgriPay - Enabling Agricultural Payments for Small Holder Farmers in Indonesia

description.narrative:
The number of undernourished people in the world remains unacceptably high at close to one billion. Depending on estimates, 450 to 500 million of these people earn their primary living from small holder agriculture, yet the productivity of these farmers remains very low. This can be attributed to a variety of reasons, including barriers to accessing inputs, modern farm technologies, markets and financial services. Sustainable access to financial services, including savings, credit, payments, and insurance, is scarce in the rural areas of most developing countries, where cash is a significant constraint to development. Combining the adoption of improved technology and access to financial services is critical to unleashing the production and profit potential for small holder farmers. Mercy Corps is uniquely positioned to implement programming to address these challenges—with the geographic footprint, expertise in financial inclusion, banking and technology infrastructure and partnerships and knowledge of the communities in which we serve—needed for success. AgriPay will address the challenge of making financial services available at scale and at affordable prices commercially in remote areas and lean markets. Digital payment systems and mobile technology offer new, cost-effective, efficient and scalable solutions to address these challenges and promote financial inclusion.
Targeted regions: Central & East Java Direct: 2,500 small holder farmers (30% women) over 12 month project; 105,000 farmers within three years Indirect beneficiaries: 12,500 indirect household beneficiaries over project; 525,000 indirect within three years
